runs.comm: leans positively into this length delivery and pushes it to the right of mid-off for a single. That must have felt nice, the ball hitting the middle of the bat
nice slingy action from Wardlaw. Pitches it on length around off stump and Bell comes forward to defend it to point
back of length outside off, goes to the keeper with a spongy bounce. Bell had left it alone
decent shape as this one swings away from Bell. The keeper takes it ankle high after the batsman has left it alone
he is playing the patient game. There is not much pace but Wardlaw is keeping it nice and tight outside off. Bell leaves it alone
a touch fuller and Bell accepts the invitation, leaning forward and pushing it through extra cover neatly for his first runs
pacier than Wardlaw, he pitches it up and around off stump, Moeen doesn't come too far forward, defends it to cover comfortably  though
stays in the crease but easily whips it through midwicket as the line is on the pads
looks for the one that goes away from the left-hander but loses direction, this is wide outside off
appeal for caught behind down the leg side but this was quite far down. Moeen did look to flick it down, prompting the appeal
gets his radar right. Bowls length just outside off. Moeen lets it go through
poor line again, this one slips down the leg side. England won't mind the free runs at all
a positive lunge forward from Moeen. He stretches out and punches the length delivery straight to extra cover
full and wide outside off, Moeen looks to cream it before just pulling out of the shot at the last moment
another teasing delivery. This is full but too wide, fourth one of the over
now beats the bat! The direction was just outside off and it was full enough to invite the drive, but Moeen didn't come too far out and ended up pushing inside the line
short delivery, comes slow off the surface but Bell misses out as he mistimes a pull straight to midwicket
goes back and across and defends the back of length delivery to midwicket
length delivery on the middle stump line, Bell defends it towards mid on
stays in the crease and defends the back of length delivery back towards the bowler
teasing line and length outside off, and that it's not skidding off the surface keeps the batsman circumspect. Bell defends it towards point
fuller this time, Bell comes forward and drives it straight to mid-off. That completes a maiden
gets the first boundary of the day with a neat drive. This was not full enough, but Moeen leant on it, opening the face slightly and finding the gap between cover and point
is that a drop? That was hammered to cover where the fielder is just not able to get under it. A low chance. Probably just landed short. The batsman went for a full-blooded on-the-up punch there
in the air again but this is safely over point! Another forceful shot from Moeen. This is just a length delivery outside off and Moeen throws his bat at that
the best looking shot of the day fetches him no runs. This is full and it's beautifully driven down the ground, but straight to mid-off
he is looking to move on now. Again leans into the drive and because he uses so much wrist, they tend to go square. Finds point now.

Superb hit! This has been driven over mid-off with utter ease. It was fuller outside off, but this time, rather than going square, he just chips it over with a straight bat. A bagful of timing behind that one
more sedate cricket from Bell as he allows this one to go through
left outside off again. Bell is giving a lot of respect to the good deliveries
spots the shortness in length early and pulls it to wide mid-on for a quick single. Not much timing there
he gives is one mighty swing but makes no connection. It's an easy call for a wide as this is well down the leg side. Moeen was looking to sent it over fine leg
back of length delivery on the stumps, tucked away to midwicket
serves up another fuller delivery on off stump, driven to mid-off firmly
goes back of length on a tight line around off, the batsman defends it off the back foot
hammered! This is short and sits up waist high without any real pace. Bell swivels and slaps it behind square to pick up his first boundary

huge shout for lbw! That looked dead plumb live! It stayed low, caught Bell on the crease. The umpire doesn't give it. Scotland think about a review but decide against it. Lucky. This cut back in and was grazing the leg stump. Would have stayed with umpire's call if it was given
back of length outside off, punched straight to point
drifts on to the pads, this is tucked to fine leg with ease
fuller and wider outside off, Moeen avoids getting sucked into it, leaves it alone
he comes forward and nudges the length delivery in front of midwicket for an easy single
another one nips back into Bell and strikes him on the pads. This time the bounce saves him.
there is a gully in place but Moeen rides the bounce and guides the back of length delivery past that man, down to third man
too short and at 127 kph, lacks any zing to trouble Bell. He sits back in the crease and slaps it through square leg. The ball slows down in the heavy outfield
that made a solid sound! This was short and on off, again doesn't have the pace. Moeen was in position early and pulls it firmly over midwicket for another boundary
back of length delivery on the stumps, defended to midwicket
fuller and swinging away outside off, Bell takes a good solid forward stride before letting it go through
stays back to this length delivery and steers it past the diving point fielder for a single to third man
stays in the crease and tucks the length delivery behind square on the leg side for a single. They think about a second but decide against it as the fielder has charged in
back of length outside off, Moeen comes forward and punches it on-the-up, to cover
back of length but this is on the hips, neatly tucked away to fine leg
stays in the crease and defends the length delivery towards point
he tried to pull the bat out of the way at the last moment, but it hits the wood and rolls away through backward point. Easy single
this one cuts in to the left hander and beats the inside edge as he looks to push it to midwicket. No appeal there as this was going down
fires it in the blockhole, but there is not much pace there. Easily dug out
goes full again, but this ends up being a half-volley on the leg stump line, Bell loves it and picks up two more with an easy drive through midwicket
neat back foot punch, and good work at mid-off! Moeen stood up and looked for the gap at wide mid-off, but the dive  from the fielder saves a few runs
chases a wide delivery but is beaten as this cuts in a touch to beat the inside edge
some solid defence now as he keeps his bat close to the pad as he pushes it to cover
almost punches it back to the bowler. This was fuller on off stump and he went after it with a straight bat. The bowler gets a hand to it, slowing it to mid-off
length delivery on off stump, the batsman defends it to the leg side

he gets a four with an edge! That was a careless push at the length delivery - he didn't really come forward as he looked to drive - this one just slipped past the gully fielder and then past the third-man
stays in the crease and defends the length delivery to midwicket
that's not that short, but short enough for Moeen to pick it up from outside off and whack it over midwicket. England moving along nicely at the moment
some solid defence now as he comes forward and gets behind the line of the length delivery
stays in the crease and tucks the back of length delivery towards fine leg for a single
lunges forward to the length delivery and punches it on the up through cover. There is a sweeper in place now
a cracker! That 123 kph delivery just squared him up completely. It hit the length and moved away so late, it opened up Bell's defence completely
two in two! Bell is not really coming forward but that could be what has saved him here from getting an edge. This one seams away at the last moment to beat the bat
now follows it up with a poor delivery! He was looking for the big inswing but this slips down the leg side
finally gets his defence right. Takes a good step forward and punches it to cover
he comes forward and drives the fuller delivery through cover to pick up a single to the deep
back of length on the stumps, Moeen nudges it through midwicket for a quick single
tossed up wide outside off. Moeen doesn't take a step forward but looks to thrash it only to get an underedge between the keeper's legs. That was slow.. 71 kph
another one that is slow and loopy. Moeen waits and defends it down the pitch
that lack of pace is not going to help if you pitch short! Moeen sits back in the crease and slaps it over wide long-on with utter ease
still very slow and loopy. It's full this time though and Moeen drives it to deep cover
this 1950-style offspin almost got a wicket! Bell pushes at it too early and it was in the air for sometime before landing short of midwicket
he has to wait in the crease for the ball before tucking it through square leg for a single
fires it in the blockhole, Bell gets a bit of an inside edge and picks up a couple to fine leg
too full again, Bell pushes it comfortably to wide long on for a single
length delivery on the stumps, Moeen comes forward and defends it to cover
back of length on the stumps, with no pace to trouble him, Moeen defends it with ease

floats it up on off stump only to see it disappear over his head! Moeen is quick to spot the length and scoops it over mid-on to reach his half-century with a boundary. Excellent start for Moeen and England.
back of length on off, chopped away to deep point for a single
that slow and loopy offspin again, 46 mph. Moeen waits an ice age before punching it through to deep cover
Bell gets ready to punch the delivery to the on side, but it doesn't arrive. He ends up tapping it to midwicket
comes forward and defends this one to midwicket
turns in towards the leg stump line, Bell nudges it straight to short fine leg
full and flighted, not easy to play these slower ones, the batsman drives it to midwicket
the world does an extra rotation before this one arrives. Bell, then, nudges it to deep square leg
length delivery on the stumps, defended to the leg side with ease
back of length outside off, he waits in the crease before running it down to third man
comes forward and defends it down the pitch
fuller and on the off stump, Moeen drives but straight to mid-off
the lack of pace means he has to wait before defending this length delivery towards point
another fuller one, another one that sails over the boundary! How easily does he do that! Just leans into the drive before going with a full followthrough to lift it up.. Easily hit over long off
tossed up and full, Bell looks to hit across the line, drives it from wide outside off to long on
he keeps it hanging it in the air. The batsman comes forward and defends it down the pitch
this one keeps coming in to the batsman from round the stumps. Moeen was playing it of the back foot and pushes it to cover
driven in the air but lands short of the cover fielder! That's what he is looking to do.. bowl it slow and induce a false drive
stays back and punches the length delivery firmly to deep cover
floated on the middle stump line, Bell stays back and tucks it to midwicket
length delivery on off stump, Moeen gets an under edge behind point as he looks to push it to cover
fuller on off, now Bell takes the aerial route, drives it comfortably over mid-off for a boundary. He did not try to hit that hard at all, just chipped it over
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman tucks it through midwicket
short and asking to be hit! Moeen swivels and pulls it firmly in the gap behind square. That brings up the 100 of the innings.
rolls his fingers on this one as he bowls it full on off stump, Moeen pushes it to mid-off
Haq has some work to do at mid-off as this is hit firmly by Moeen. The fielder does well, diving to his right to prevent it from running away. That's drinks
tossed up full and wide outside off, Moeen leans into it and drives it to deep cover
he comes forward and eases the flighted delivery past the diving bowler to long on
waits in the crease and defends this pushed through delivery back down the pitch
tossed up on the stumps, it's driven to long on but this is a Finn no-ball, Haq has knocked down the bails at his end with his back foot
a lot of width in this one, Bell misses out a touch as he cuts it straight to deep cover
gets an outside edge but there is no one at slip! This slow pace is keeping everyone guessing.
too full this time, Moeen drives it down to long on for a single
length delivery from round the stumps, Moeen leans into it and eases it to deep cover
bowls length just outside off, pushed to cover off the front foot
short, but slow as a snail, the batsman has to wait a bit before swatting it down to fine leg
back of length delivery on off, the batsman waits on the back foot and defends it down the pitch
on the pads this time but Moeen punches it straight to midwicket
stays in the crease and solidly defends the length delivery to the off side
pushed through on the stumps, a bit quicker than Haq at 90 kph, Bell stays back and whips it away to deep square leg
bowls with a round-arm, almost Malinga-like action, the batsman defends it to the leg side
waits in the crease and punches the length delivery to deep cover
on the pads again, Bell doesn't mind that, flicked away to deep square leg with ease
shorter delivery outside off, Moeen misses out as he gets no timing in his pull, trickles away to long on
goes back and across and picks up another single to deep square leg
fuller delivery on off stump, Bell is not taking any chances as yet, defends this solidly to off
comes behind the line of this length ball and punches it in the vast expanse to the right of deep cover, it doesn't run to the boundary but there is enough time for a couple
back of length on off, the batsman chops it through gully
short delivery this time, a slower bouncer really, or maybe it was bowled at full pace but got stuck in the pitch, sails over the batsman's head
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it to cover
back of length on the stumps, Moeen defends it down the pitch
waits in the crease and clips it to deep square leg for an easy single
flatter and on the pads, the batsman looks to tuck it to square leg but misses out
finally, he uses his feet, but this is flatter and quicker. Moeen goes through with his chip shot nonetheless to pick up a single to long on
waits on the back foot and punches it through to deep cover
tossed up on the stumps, Bell punches it to long-on comfortably
more easy runs down the ground as Moeen punches one off the back foot to long on
these short ones are not really helping Scotland. There is no pace on this attempted bouncer and it doesn't really climb up. Moeen swivels and hammers it behind square to pick the gap
fuller and on off stump, the batsman drives it down the pitch, back to the bowler
direct hit at the striker's end but Bell dives to get in safely. They haven't been eager on such runs, but this time Moeen dabs it towards cover and calls for it
fuller delivery on the stumps, the batsman drives it straight to mid-on
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
length delivery outside off, Bell waits patiently and dabs it down to third man
gets some swing immediately and some added pace as well, Bell defends it from the crease
back of length outside off, Bell stays back and chops it down to third man

the increase in pace as probably just helped Moeen with his timing here! This is short and it's swatted away behind square for yet another boundary. There is a man in the deep and he has been beaten every single time
length delivery on the stumps, he comes forward and punches it down to long off
full and on the middle stump line, the batsman defends it down the pitch
back of length outside off, Bell wanted to pull it to deep midwicket but is not able to beat the man in the circle. Not much timing behind that shot either
slow and loopy on the stumps, the batsman leans forward and defends
looks to slog this out of its presence but doesn't get any timing, more of a bottom edge to deep midwicket
waits for the ball to turn before punching it through cover for a single
this is slow and loopy again, Bell is not taking any chances, drives it through midwicket
gets some width outside off and he goes through with the inside-out chip shot! Over the cover fielder but there is man in the deep to cut that off
stays back and defends the slow train down the pitch
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
short and wide, Bell gets the poor delivery he wants, slaps it in front of square but still can't find the boundary
stays back and steers the back of length delivery down to third man
gives away an extra as he pushes this down the leg side
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman punches it to cover
floated up on the pads, the batsman nudges it to the left of midwicket
back of length on the stumps, Bell swivels and pulls it down to deep square leg
he waits in the crease and defends it down the pitch
waits for a light year before nudging this to midwicket
loopy and bowled at 77 kph, the batsman waits and chops it to short third man
comes forward and nudges it to backward square leg
throws it way high in the air and Bell takes that as an invitation for a sweep, does it well, hitting it crisply to deeps square leg
he comes forward and defends the length delivery down the pitch
waits in the crease before punching the back of length delivery to deep cover
length delivery outside off, forcefully punched to deep extra cover for a couple
bowls an offcutter that is pushed past the non-striker for a quick single. The fielder from mid-off hits the stumps at non-striker's but Moeen was safely in
stands tall and punches it beautifully for a single to deep cover, that shot brings up his half-century as well. It has been hard work for Bell but he has the extra gear
stays in the crease and pushes the length delivery to cover
back of length, Moeen stays back and gets better timing this time as he pushes it to deep cover
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman defends it solidly to off

that almost hits the Toyota Hyundai Genesis parked in the podium! Moeen had had enough. Get under this tossed up delivery and hammers it over midwicket to bring up a well-compiled century. Applause all around. That is one important innings for the confidence of the whole batting line up
defends the length delivery to cover
waits on the back foot and opens the face of the bat to run it down at the last moment

now Bell joins in in the fun! Gets under this tossed up delivery and looks to do what Moeen did three balls ago, but just doesn't get the distance.. it lands at the cow corner but doesn't reach the boundary
stays on the back foot and defends it to midwicket
he comes forward and pushes this back towards the bowler, it stayed in the air for a bit but lands safely
fuller this time, the batsman makes no attempt to keep it down, punches it over the infield but gets only a single to deep cover
he waits in the crease and pushes the length ball down to long on
he comes forward and drives this on-the-up to long off for a single
this one is chipped in the air too, but right in the gap at cover. No timing there at all from Bell - he played that too early
comes forward and defends this down the pitch

he is gone, he has given it away really! Goes for the big booming drive off this fuller delivery but fails to keep it down.. Straight into the hands of Coetzer at cover. He may have thrown away the chance to improve his strike rate but this opening stand has set up the perfect platform for his team.
fuller delivery on the stumps, the batsman drives it down to mid-on
gets a fuller delivery wide outside off and he squeezes it through cover to get off the mark
slower delivery on the stumps, the batsman nudges it straight to midwicket
length delivery on off stump, no room there to play with, Ballance defends it to midwicket
waits in the crease and steers it down to third man
fuller on the off stump, the batsman drives it down to long off for a single
looks to slog sweep as soon as he sees this is headed down the leg side, but gets an underedge to short fine leg

that's a proper smack! Coetzer went round the wicket but this back of length delivery just sits up for Moeen. He was waiting for it and sends it into a cloud of orange t-shirts, none of whom is able to have a grab a that
fuller delivery on the stumps, driven down to long on
fuller on the pads, the batsman digs it out towards midwicket and calls for a quick single
fuller delivery outside off, the batsman leans into it and drives it to deep cover
gets his front leg out of the way as he looks to drive this fuller delivery, but straight to the man at cover
too full outside off, the batsman opens the face as he drives, hits it crisply to deep cover
fuller on the middle stump line, the batsman drives it firmly down to long on
he keeps serving the fuller length, the batsman drives it through cover point for another single
Moeen is batting at a higher gear. Clears his front leg out and hammers the fuller delivery over the bowler's head to pick up another boundary.
another one in the hitting zone! This is poor bowling. Berrington gives him space too and Moeen drives it firmly through cover to pick up his second boundary this over
length delivery outside off, the batsman looks to push it to the leg side but finds the man at midwicket
now he looks to dab it behind point  but ends up dropping it down to his boots
back of length outside off, the batsman cuts it down to third man to get off strike
he was looking to slog it away to Australia but misses completely, beaten by the lack of pace there
good yorker this time, the batsman can only dig it out to the off side

fuller and drifting on the pads, Moeen whips it behind square on the leg side to pick up another boundary. This brings up the 200 of the innings. With the short fine leg up, that's one area not to bowl
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
stays back and pushes it towards midwicket with soft hands for a single

no 200 for Moeen! He has slogged this straight into the hands of the lone fielder at deep midwicket. That slow pace from Majid, it did play some part there because Moeen wasn't able to swing is bat on the cue. Had to wait an extra moment and that meant he didn't get the power behind it. Excellent innings though.
he stays back and defends this one to midwicket
comes down the pitch, first time anyone has looked to do that against Majid, drives it to long on
he comes forward and keeps the strike with a single to long off
And there is another wicket! Ballance's poor run continues as he chops this down on to his stumps. He wanted to run it down to third man but the lack of pace messed up his timing. Reward for Evans
back of length outside off, the batsman defends it solidly to cover
length delivery on the stumps, Morgan comes forward and defends it to short cover
he comes forward and drives it fluently, but can't thread that cap. That flies through to the man at cover
shortens his length and pushes the batsman on the back foot, Morgan defends
superb lines from Evans, he keeps it tight around off and there is not much Morgan can do with it. Defends it down the pitch

and another one! Root follows the rest. This is an excellent delivery at this juncture of the innings. Pitches on a length just outside off and straightens just a touch to kiss the outside edge. Not much Root could have done about that really. Excellent stuff.
almost gets squared up as he defends this length delivery down the pitch
pushes this one with soft hands to mid-on but there is not run there
slightly slower but on target around off stump, the batsman can only defend it to the off side
outside edge! But there is only one slip in place. This was floated up wide outside off and Taylor chased it, without getting close to it. First run of the Powerplay
another good over! Morgan punches it in the air to see it land only a couple of meters short of mid-off. England 1 for 2 in the Powerplay
length delivery on the leg stump line, easily tucked away through square leg for a single
they all appeal for lbw but this was probably going over the stumps. Morgan, though, was stuck in the crease and played outside the line of a straight one
pushes this one down the leg side to give away an extra
length delivery outside off, Morgan covers the stumps and lets it go through
length delivery outside off, Morgan looks to punch it through off but gets a bit of an inside edge towards midwicket
back of length delivery on the pads, easily clipped away down to fine leg
full and on the pads, Taylor whips it easily through midwicket to pick up a single to the deep
the pace is up from Scotland, their tails are up too. Taylor stays on the back foot and dabs the back of length delivery to third man
bowls a slower one on the pads, Morgan pushes it through midwicket with soft hands to pick up a single
a good slower bouncer now! The batsman looks to pull but doesn't make contact
he goes back and across and works the length delivery away to deep midwicket for a single
another one down the leg side. Scotland are bowling well but time and time again, they are giving away these extras
and another one down the leg side. The over should have been done by now
that's the first of the extra delivery! He bowls it full outside off and Morgan smashes it over wide mid-off
that's better from Davey, length delivery on off. Morgan can only punch it to cover
down the leg side and Taylor has no problems flicking it fine and collecting a quick couple
now he dabs it towards cover and calls for a quick single
too straight again and it's easily clipped away to deep midwicket for a single
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman nudges it straight to midwicket
finds the gap at cover with a neat push! He leans into this length delivery and places it in the gap but it doesn't have the legs to make it to the boundary
back of length delivery, Morgan clips it to fine leg for a single
solid defence from Morgan as he comes right behind the line of this length delivery and pushes it down the pitch
bowls a short one now, fairly quick too, and it surprises the charging Morgan. The batsman pulls out of the way in the end
back of length on the leg stump line, the batsman swats it down to fine leg
length delivery on the stumps, no room to nudge it around, Taylor defends it down the pitch
waits on the back foot and pushes it straight to point
fires it in the blockhole and Taylor does well to dig it out to mid-on. Another good over
that slow pace from Majid almost accounted for Morgan here! The batsman wanted to smash it over long off but gets no timing, ends up limply lobbing it and it lands just short of long off
slow, slower.. Taylor has to wait before defending it to the off side
looks for the reverse sweep but makes no connection
he goes deep in the crease and swat away this tossed up delivery, just a single to deep square leg
tossed up again, makes Morgan wait before the batsman defends
fuller this time, the batsman punches it to long off past a diving cover fielder

that has been clobbered away over deep midwicket for a six, but the fielder has actually misjudged this.. He could have been gone here. Coleman was standing a few yards inside and couldn't judge his leap. This hits the skirting on the full. The short ball almost accounted for a wicket there
full and wide outside off, Morgan is not going to miss out on those, drives it cleanly and over cover for yet another boundary
length delivery tight on the pads, he can only push it to midwicket
superbly timed drive but very unlucky that he has hit it straight to short cover
waits in the crease and cuts the back of length delivery for a couple to deep backward point
looks to drive this widish delivery through covers but the lack of pace means he gets an inside edge down the pitch
he comes forward and clips the flighted delivery to deep square leg for a single
reaches out for this lobbed delivery and slices it to the left of short third man for a single
leaves the crease but he is not to the pitch of the delivery, defends it to the leg side
makes room as he comes down the pitch and slogs it towards cow corner... No timing again with that lack of pace
stays low in the crease and cracks it off the back foot for a single to deep point
here comes the reverse sweep but he hits it straight to short third man.

goes across and looks to scoop it over short fine leg but gets hit on the pads. The impact was outside off, otherwise it looked like one they could have at least appealed for. Oh strange. No appeal, but they are reviewing the umpire's call of not out. Someone must have asked the question in his ear. The replay shows it's probably hit the glove.
waits in the crease and smartly plays a late cut to run it down for a single down to third man

goes back and across and swings across the line to this fuller delivery! Takes it from outside off and whacks it towards the cow corner. It's a big boundary in that direction so it doesn't quite make it all the way, but does trickle over
slower delivery on the stumps the batsman drops it towards midwicket for a single

superb work by Cross behind the stumps! Taylor jumped out of the crease and probably the bowler pushed it full and wide. It's an excellent take - a half-volley just inside the wide marker - then he follows it up with some quick glovework to take the bails off. England continue to struggle for late momentum. That could have been called a wide but the umpire probably felt generous.
takes a step down the crease and whips the fuller delivery beautifully through midwicket to start off with a boundary
doesn't help if you test your keeper again and again while he is standing up. This one is well down the leg side and Cross does well to stop it running away
another one down the leg side, more good work by Cross
fuller outside off, the batsman comes forward and chips it over the non-striker for a single to long off

moves away to the leg side to give himself room, but the bowler follows him there. The batsman misses, another test for Cross. He doesn't take it cleanly this time as it's bouncing up on him, but prevents it from running away
now he moves to the off side and picks up the length delivery over Cross' left shoulder for a boundary. Life is getting too hard if you are a Cross
looks for the reverse-swat and although he gets some bat on it, it's not a solid connection. The man at short third-man dives to his left to cut it off
full and on off stump, Morgan thumps it down the ground for a single down to long off
slower bouncer outside off, the batsman drags it away to deep midwicket for a single, not much timing there
bowls a low full toss that Morgan can only punch to long off. Looks like he was beaten a bit by the lack of pace
dropped by the bowler! That has been swatted back at Wardlaw at a comfortable height but he just didn't have enough time to react
low full toss on the pads, Buttler misses out as he gets an inside edge to short fine leg. Any connection in that direction and would have certainly gone for four
comes down the pitch but misses out again as the bowler follows him, Morgan gets hit on the pads
superb yorker! Buttler does well by squeezing it out fine on the off side and scampers through for a couple
this time he gets under it properly! This is full and wide outside off, Buttler stretches out and thumps it over extra cover for a well-timed boundary
full and a touch slower, Morgan can only dig it out down the ground for a single
the batsman misses out as this was on a length just outside off, but there was just enough away movement to beat Buttler's swing
comes down the pitch and punches the slower delivery straight past the bowler for another couple. Finding boundaries continues to be hardwork
comes down the pitch to which the bowler responds by pushing it wide. It's right over the marker and is called a wide
gets a low full toss but Buttler was already going with the reverse ramp shot, just gets some bat on it and pings the gap at backward point
comes forward and punches it through covers for a single
throws his bat at this full and wide one but ends up slicing it over point. It lands safely again but yields just a single

now that's some connection! This is a half-volley and it's hammered down the ground towards the sight screen. There is a catcher getting under it, one in an orange shirt,.. he is alone and he has all the time, but he is not able to grab at that
on the pads and Morgan sweeps it behind square on the leg side for yet another boundary
goes back to the yorker that can only be dug out to the leg side for a single

smashed straight into the hands of long off! He moved away to the leg side, the bowler pushes it wide outside off, which means Buttler doesn't get it off the meat of the bat. He could have gone over cover with that but chose to go straight
misses out on this low full toss as he flicks it straight to short fine leg
fuller on the pads, the batsman punches it to long on for a single
full and wide, the idea is right but the execution isn't, another extra takes England to 300

captain takes out the captain! Morgan looked to slog across the line but got a big top edge. Mommsen, at midwicket, had to backpedal to get under it. He keeps his eyes on the swirler and gets under it comfortably
another ball, another top edge, another catch by Mommsen! He runs to his right from extra cover towards mid-off and takes another steepler. Same finish too. Falling backwards as he completed that
won't get it. It's back of length on the pads and Broad, who doesn't get any bat on it, picks up a leg bye to get off strike
fuller on the middle stump, Finn gets off the mark with a whip to deep midwicket
looks to swing it across the line but misses it completely! Broad used to be a decent bat once
and misses it again! They pick up a single off the bye. England finish with 303 for 8
